review_title: If you need the work apply but be careful on who you trust or befriend
pros: Beautiful new hospital.  Cafe food is the best.
cons: This hospital has the worst upper management and culture I have worked at.  They have a network of whose who.  I have seen them degrade people based on their background or not growing up in Rchmond or graduating with your boss.  The culture is from the CEO downwards.  Most employees are afraid to voice any concerns.  HR only serves those that back stab and spy on their behalf.  They have voice training but yet top of the house do not utilize the skills they require every other employee to live by.  The environment is deceiving.  Give yourself 6months and you will see what many other employees see.  Very sad for those of us that truly love what we do and the patients we serve.

job_title: Home Services Health Aide in Richmond, IN
pros: Patients are number one- hands down- the reason for being there, but there was lots of personal pride for the JACHO certification in all departments, ongoing monthly training, rediness support that crossed over departments, Lots of wider community involvement and educating for promoting good health and self advocacy. Good team comraderie, too.
cons: If out visiting a remote home visit and weather turns bad, have to be prepared to stay- but that would only be very rare,  also, lots of travel time- ok if weather is good, but I have had to scrape ice off windows and doors of car to get back in after  home visits. (This is job specific)

pros: There are some...NOT MANY people you can trust and some good people on board.
cons: Everything. If you arent part of the "cool kids" club forget it..you will go nowhere and be treated like crap. They try to control EVERY expect of your life. Bosses follow you home, constantly check up on you...even if given good reviews once you have a target on your back...its over. THey will find the most stupid things to write you up over (cologne, shirt being wrinkled, seeming tired of working a long string of hours, etc.). NOT a good place to work.

review_title: My experience has NEVER been anything but thoughtful, comfortable with staff and trustworthy.
pros: Great team, great patients, great perks, benefits and pay for the work I do.
cons: When u get close to patients and then they pass, or drawing on babies, could be hazardous when drawing on disgruntled patients whom may not adjust well to having blood drawn.

pros: The pros to working at reid in general is discounts you get for medications, and you earn vacation time every pay check no matter how short of time you have been there. Pharmacy specific would be being in a small area, most co workers are nice and management is verg easy to talk to and are very nice.
cons: You will likely work a lot of over time if you are a good worker because they call the same people in over and over for dependability. Employment turn over rate is very high, many people hired dont have a work ethic, in my 1 year here they fired 15 people.

pros: Healthy work family environment, yearly pay raises dependent on performance reviews
cons: Poor health insurance benefits, mandatory overtime- IT NEVER GOES AWAY,  consistently works the floor understaffed, high turn over of staff, management is spread thin therefore is rarely in tune with staff needs or present on the unit, high stress environments, administration asks for more and more from employees without little compensation or consideration for their mental health.

review_title: Good Staff, management can be questionable but is usually great
job_title: Nursing Care Assistant in Richmond, IN
pros:
Awesome nurses and doctors. Absolutely no complaints.
Management was usually very understanding and supportive, and understood the stress the job could have.
cons: Upper management was a bit out of touch sometimes, but they tried their hardest. CEO encouraged us and was very positive, but I had some difficulty connecting with him because he was more on the business side than healthcare. The CNO is great and has been an RN for a very long time.
